perturbation.original_text: Distributor can find more information about the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act at the following URL: http://www.usdoj.gov/criminal/fraud/docs/dojdocb.html, o r  b y contacting publicsectorcompllance@cisco.com.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor can find more information about product returns at the following URL: http://www.usdoj.gov/criminal/fraud/docs/dojdocb.html, o r  b y contacting publicsectorcompllance@cisco.com.
perturbation.explanation: The original text correctly directed the distributor to resources regarding the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. The modified text repurposes this guidance within a section that mandates compliance with anti-corruption laws, but incorrectly links the distributor to resources regarding product returns. This obfuscates where to find the relevant legal information and potentially misleads the distributor, weakening compliance.

perturbation.original_text: (o) Distributor can report to Cisco any concerns it may have regarding any business practices by emailing ethics@cisco.com, or by calling Cisco's Helpline toll free number In North America 1- 877-571-1700 or worldwide number (reverse calling charges to Cisco) 001-770-776-5611. Contact ethics@cisco.com for other Cisco) 001-770-776-5611. Contact ethics@cisco.com for other available regional hotline numbers;
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor may, but is not required, to report to Cisco any concerns it may have regarding business practices by emailing ethics@cisco.com, or calling Cisco's helpline with no guarantee of a response. Contact ethics@cisco.com for other available regional hotline numbers, but response times may vary.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'can report' to 'may, but is not required, to report', the modification weakens the encouragement for reporting unethical business practices. The phrase 'with no guarantee of a response' further discourages reporting and makes it difficult to enforce a claim that Cisco provides a method to report these practices.

perturbation.original_text: (n) Notwithstanding any other provision in this Agreement, Cisco may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if Distributor breaches any of the representations and warranties set forth in this section.
perturbation.changed_text: (n) Notwithstanding any other provision in this Agreement, Cisco may consider terminating this Agreement upon written notice if Distributor breaches any of the representations and warranties set forth in this section; termination is not guaranteed.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'may terminate immediately' to 'may consider terminating', the modification introduces ambiguity and weakens Cisco's ability to enforce immediate termination in case of a breach of the representations and warranties. The phrase 'termination is not guaranteed' further waters down the original intent.
